title: Daily Note - 2025-06-27
summary: A significant day was spent overhauling the core game logic for Collapsi due to a misunderstanding of movement rules, implementing proper DFS pathfinding and developing a robust theme system. This change made the game strategically richer.
accomplishments: Fixed Core Game Logic: Rewrote get_valid_moves() to use DFS pathfinding allowing orthogonal movement with direction changes
Updated Backend API: Modified endpoints to work with destination-based moves instead of path-based
Created Theme System: Implemented 5 themes (Cyberpunk, Classic Board, Neon Nights, Minimalist, Retro Arcade) with localStorage persistence
UI Polish: Removed confusing path visualization, fixed layout to fit on one screen, made responsive design
insights: Allowing direction changes during movement makes the game significantly more strategic
DFS pathfinding is computationally manageable for 4x4 board with max 4 moves
Simple click-to-destination UI is more intuitive than path building
Theme system adds nice personalization without complexity
A major breakthrough was fixing the movement rules, transforming the game from simple to strategically rich.
The "aha" moment about direction changes was crucial.
learning: Read: Game rules documentation (realized movement allows turns!)
Discovered: DFS with backtracking is perfect for small board pathfinding
challenges: Started the day with a major misconception about the Collapsi game rules - thought movement was restricted to straight lines only. This led to a complete overhaul of the game logic.
future_work: Test game engine thoroughly with edge cases
